text: Am I reading correctly that it supports both LP and MIP? That might push me to update LongestPaths to MOI.

elements.text: Am I reading correctly that it supports both LP and MIP? That might push me to update LongestPaths to MOI.

text: AFAIK, HiGHS is an LP solver with basic support for MIP, i.e., it should handle small MIPs but will likely die on large ones

elements.text: AFAIK, HiGHS is an LP solver with basic support for MIP, i.e., it should handle small MIPs but will likely die on large ones

text: Thanks, then I guess I'll wait with trying it.

elements.text: Thanks, then I guess I'll wait with trying it.

text: looks like it's under very active development, which is exciting.  Performance so far doesn't look that good, any reason to believe it'll be more competitive in the future?

elements.text: looks like it's under very active development, which is exciting.  Performance so far doesn't look that good, any reason to believe it'll be more competitive in the future?

text: as opposed to clp and cbc you mean?

elements.text: as opposed to clp and cbc you mean?

text: What's the main selling point/promise of HiGHS? Distributed computation?

elements.text: What's the main selling point/promise of HiGHS? Distributed computation?

text:
>  as opposed to clp and cbc you mean?
As opposed to itself. I was talking about the LP solver.
Last time I checked the code, the MIP part was just a simple branch-and-bound algorithm.

> What's the main selling point/promise of HiGHS? Distributed computation?
HiGHS is the product of research on parallelizing the dual simplex, so that's one.
Among the open-source LP solvers --> at least good documentation :sweat_smile:

elements.text: as opposed to clp and cbc you mean?
